reviews.review_msg: Its easy to fall behind in his class, but if you keep up, his practice questions that are reviewed in lecture are very similar to the tests and quizzes. He's very nice and the exams are difficult but he gives you enough study material to do good. May be a bit hard if you didn't do well in BISC101 and 102 because he doesn't spend much time on them.

Although BISC 202 has a lot of information, Dr. Bains made the experience easier on everyone.  He does use a flipped classroom method which allowed for more practice questions in class.  These questions definitely helped when it came to exams and quizzes.  Also, he was more than willing to address questions in lecture and office hours.

Thanks to Dr. Bains and my TA, I was able to recover in the course after a not-so-good start.  Dr. B. was willing to assist me during office hours to figure out concepts that I did not understand.  The practice questions in lecture that I got right gave me confidence in upcoming quizzes and exams.  I hope to take another course with him.
got B because  the exams where really hard

Dr. Bains is the best. He uses a different teaching method than most profs, where lectures are pre-recorded and he does tons of practice questions during lecture. Personally I really enjoyed his method of teaching since BSIC 202 is more about understanding concepts rather than memorization. He is very fair, but exams are long.

Flipped classroom worked for my friends and I.  Lots of practice questions to help prepare for the major exams.  The videos to view before classes may have been long at times but very thorough in explaining concepts.  To the comment by the student who got a C, class average on the final was 67%.  Majority of the students did better than you say.

Enjoyed the course,  Dr. Bains is a great teacher.  He was always available to address my questions.  The practice questions in class helped for the short answer part of the final exam.  I would definitely take another course with him.
His passing grade for 202 this semester was 42.5. The class performed so poorly they had to drop the passing mark to 42.5!!!! Just take genetics (or other classes) with a different instructor.

Love Dr. Bains!!!!  He gave chances for students to raise their grade by allowing best three of four quizzes, putting more weight on final if you do well, reducing total of exams to help all students, and having choice questions on the exams.  He does expect his students to put in the work for a better grade, but the pay off is worth it.

I really enjoyed bisc202 with Onkar. He made the course material interesting and engaging and exams were fair. Lectures are online videos and class-time is spent doing practice questions, which was really helpful in solidifying the content. You definitely need to put in the work to do well but overall amazing prof who cares for his students.
Goated prof. Take him if you have the choice.

There is a lot of material covered in BISC 202, but Dr. Bains managed to explain concepts well.  Yes, there are recorded lectures, but that left more time for practice questions in-person which really helped when it came to the quizzes and exams.  I liked that he gave choice questions on the final exam.  My friends and I enjoyed the course.
Overrated as a lecturer as his lecture is prerecorded, but you can tell he cares about his students. He hands out final exam grades like the nba draft thoughðŸ˜‚
Overrated to be honest. Solid prof

Onkar was a great prof provided so many resources to study the course itself has sooo much content but just keep practice important course for mCAT and stuff. Best prof for this course. Midterm was easy final was a bit harder but doable if you study

Dr. Bains is a very caring professor and all the topics are well explained. I am not a huge fan of the flipped classroom method as I tend to struggle to keep up with pre-recorded lectures, especially when they are fairly long. That being said, lectures were high quality and always enjoyable.

Uses a flipped classroom model where you are responsible for learning beforehand and the lectures are full of practice questions instead. Very difficult if you aren't adjusted. Practice questions were helpful and the lectures weren't bloated.

Dr. B. is one of nicest profs I had so far at SFU.  He does challenge students to strive for their best.  During the semester, he has been accommodating to my needs as a CAL student (plus, he does go to the Learning Center to address questions while I wrote my exams).  Practice questions during class are a plus which helps to prepare for exams!

Super helpful lectures so far with all the practice questions done so far.  Like the option of having higher percentage on final as a way to make up for midterm.  Gives plenty of hints about the type of questions on exams.  My TA also has been a big help in office hours.

Really enjoying the course so far.  Although the video recordings for lectures are long, they have helped in the understanding of major concepts. Student learning objectives and practice questions during lecture are a big plus!  Clearly, Dr. Bains does his best to help students out (even if you have to work harder to achieve a better grade).

For me, the flipped classroom method has worked well. I like that Dr. Bains goes through the harder material and practice questions step by step.  Yes, some of the videos can be long but at least I can review them multiple times. He does want his students to do their best, which helps to motivate me.

Flipped classroom method is really not as magical as some may make it seem. Balancing the 1 and 2 hour lectures in person during the week along with the long lecture videos between them takes up a LOT of your time. Would not recommend taking this class with him if you are taking 4 courses in that semester
Very understanding and accommodating.  So far, I really enjoy the practice questions which has been a big help in the exams.
Incredible style of teaching. The lecture slides are amazing. Quiz and midterm questions arent sneaky and stupid. Highly recommended

The first prof I have had who understands what students of today are going through.  The flipped classroom method works for me.  Lots of practice questions with some similar to the ones in the midterm.  Removes weakest quiz at end and gives greater weight on final exam if it's better than the midterm.

Onkar is one of the best profs I have had in all of my BISC courses. He is very calm, and lectures are fun with interesting content. Onkar does all he can in his power to help students succeed and learn.

ONKARR MY MANNN!!! Cant appreciate you enough for making genetics a class I actually enjoy. Thank you for restoring faith in considering a BISC minor. Please teach upper division courses and I might actually not consider giving up! Thank you for everything! THANKS FOR YOUR FLIPPED METHOD THE BEST EVER YAS! not an overstatement

He covers lots of concepts but also offers lots of practice questions that were very applicable to the exams. Lecture videos are long but he has good slides and explains concepts well. Definitely recommend taking the course with him!!

Retook the course and improved my grade from a C to a B+.  The flipped classroom method really helped me understand the concepts more.  Professor Bains was more than willing to explain things (even in different ways if I didn't understand the first or second time).  Also, he is really good at replying to email messages.

My friends and I were super lucky to have Dr. Bains teaching a difficult course.  He made things easier by providing a lot of practice questions and explaining answers step-by-step.  The course was set up for students to succeed; however, you have to attend lectures and put in the work to get a higher grade.

If you get confused, Onkar is willing to explain more than once. He's fairly quick with email responses and will help you do well in the course. Genetics was not an easy course, but you do have to put effort into getting good grades. I'm truly grateful to have him as he slightly changed the grading scale which was a GOATED move

Skipped lectures early on in the semester - big mistake!  When I started to attend lectures, Dr. Bains did a good job at explaining concepts and going through the answers in detail to difficult practice questions.  I got a B, but I am kicking myself since it is likely I would have ended up with a higher grade if I was more devoted.

Dr. Bains is amazing! Not only does he truly care for his students but he does absolutely everything he can so that you succeed. Some of the concepts in 202 are new but overall, it's not hard if you put in the work! Highly recommend taking with Dr. Bains!

Dr. B is one of the best profs I had at SFU.  He is very accommodating and establishes a positive learning environment.  The flipped classroom method worked for me, especially with the exam questions.  Some of the course material is challenging, but Dr. B did a solid job at simplifying concepts.  I hope he teaches courses in third/fourth year.
BISC 202 is not an easy course, but I was lucky to have Dr. Bains.  The amount of practice questions we went over in lecture helped me big time in the final exam.  Overall, the course was very fair!

It's a reversed method of learning ie you watch the lectures before you come. Make sure to not get too behind because it is A LOT of content - not necessarily all hard but hard. His exams were fair and quizzes were fair as well except his wording can be a bit confusing at times.

Onkar is a very good prof, his lecture are mostly practice question and problems, he say that you should watch the lecture recording before you come to class to understand what is going on but I never watched them and all the questions on exam still made sense. Just go to class participate in lecture and you should do fine.

During all exams Dr. Bains came to CAL to address any questions (so far, the only Instructor to do this during my time at SFU).  Yes there are recordings to watch but the practice questions in class gave me confidence to do well.  He is very understanding and challenges his students to do their best.  Lecture final was very fair!

Really enjoyed the lectures.  Dr. Bains was super helpful in addressing my questions.  If you come to lecture and do the practice questions, they appear on the final (but in a different format).  Totally would take another class with him in the future.

Does not teach during lecture, does practice questions instead and expects you to watch 3 hours of lecture videos before class. Exams ask abt material that he mentioned won't be on it. Said reviewing the learning objectives for each lecture will be more than enough for the final; however, he still tests on other stuff.

I absolutely adore Dr. Bains!! His lectures (and practice questions) are informative and I enjoy the animations on his slides.  He does listen to student feedback which makes me feel important as a student.  Yes, there is a lot of material to learn, but his positive attitude gives me extra motivation to put in the effort.

PROS: Understanding and accommodating, positive attitude, breaks complex concepts down step-by-step, lots of practice questions in class, checks in with students with an online survey (and even makes adjustments to the lecture based on the feedback).

Not a lot of cons (perhaps the lecture recordings are a bit long).

Fantastic teacher overall!

As a student registered with CAL, Dr. Bains is the first prof who contacted me to see if my accommodations were met and came to check in on me during the midterm. He does challenge all his students, but that is what I came to university for.  Practice questions and the learning objectives are super helpful. I would take another course with him.

My friends and I have really enjoyed his class.  There are many questions to go through which really helped with the exams.  Dr. Bains does incorporate application questions (so it is not only memorization).  The recordings have definitely helped in preparing for the in person lectures (plus he now includes reviews of concepts in the lectures).

-Nice personality
-Exams difficult 
-Strict marking 
-hybrid system 3 hours of videos beforehand lecture

It is clear that Dr. Bains wants his students to do their best.  His step-by-step explanations in the lecture recordings has helped me and my friends address practice questions in class.  I do like the gifs used too!  Also, the tutorials so far have complemented the lectures.  Lots of practice to help students get ready for exams, which is great.

He's a very nice man who's clearly knowledgable about his material, but his teaching style is awful. His lectures are not actual lectures, they're just another tutorial, directed by him. And he has awful notes that are annotated by an online lecture pre-recorded in the pandemic. I consider him to be very lazy, and unwilling to improve his teachings
He is so so. Difficult exams and very confusing slides. Read textbook since lecture notes are not enough for his exams.

Dude is a teaching all-star! Made a difficult easier to deal with. Recorded lectures were thorough (plus the animations were a nice touch). Learning objectives were super helpful. Made time to answer my questions. Lots of practice questions given in lecture which made it easier to do well on exams. Most positive Instructor Ive had at SFU.

Onkar is an amazing prof. Hiss lectures are very clear and easy to understand and hes great at explaining. His quizzes and midterms were fair, although the likes to put in a few trick questions and details. If you know everything on the lecture slides your set but pay attention to the little details. Hes very willing to help if you go to OH.

BISC 202 is a course that requires students to put in the work to do well. Luckily, Dr. B did his best (and succeeded) to make things easier by having detailed lectures and hosting practice sessions for students to work on sample questions. I really appreciated the online office hours during evenings/weekends. Great experience overall!

Finally, a course where application matters rather than just memorization. This was the best course that I took online so far. Plenty of practice questions and my TA was awesome. Dr. Bains was available (even during the evenings for office hours). I liked the animations used in the lectures and exams. Just a positive learning environment!

I really enjoyed the course. Lectures were recorded and easy to understand (especially with the learning objectives). The practice sessions were super useful in helping me prepare for quizzes/exams. Also, the prof always made time to address questions. The course is a challenge but the tools were given for students to do well.

Not a bad prof but he makes course more difficult. Slides are good but practice questions are way easier than exams. Midterms and final were really hard! he kept saying fair exams which wasn't. I would take another prof!

This was Onkar's first time teaching BISC202 and I thought he was great! He's incredibly kind and his lectures are simple and easy to understand. I really enjoyed taking this course with him and would do it again in a heartbeat! The course itself wasn't easy, but he did his best at making it easy and fair on us!

Onkar Bains is a fabulous biology teacher! His classes are lecture-heavy but if you're in BISC202, this isn't your first Bio class and you'll know this is to be expected with any bio class (lots of memorization). His exams were all very fair, no questions came as a shock and overall he is very friendly and approachable. Would happily take it again.
Really good and clear lectures; gives plenty of practice questions; Reasonable exam difficulty. I feel like I actually grasped the concepts of genetics taking the class with Onkar.

I really enjoyed this course especially when there was plenty of time to review the lectures since they are recorded. Practice sessions and tutorials were helpful and exam questions were fair. The lecture final had similar questions to the midterms which was nice! Dr. Bains was very understanding and responded to emails (even at night!).

if you are expecting to do this course just be reviewing the lectures and showing up to tutorials, well then run! Quizzes after every chapter. very very difficult questions. question done in tutorials is nothing like the quizzes. Let's not even talk about how difficult the exams are. want to succeed? All I can say is good luck!

Dr. Bains is a fantastic and kind professor. His lectures are great (albeit they're sometimes long) and learning objectives were useful. The supplementary videos under the lectures were helpful in understanding each topic. I would take a course with him again if I could.

BISC 202 is a challenging course but Dr. Bains (and his TAs) did a good job to make it easier to understand. Always on top of responding to emails and setting up office hours throughout the week. The real life examples used in lectures were interesting. Also, the practice sessions really helped me to do well on the exams.

Dr. Bains is one of the nice professors and is passionate about learning BUT his lectures are really long and his exams are really wordy/ long making it confusing to understand. Since youre entire grade is basically just your exams I wouldn't take this particular course with him again but he was good in BISC 101.

Kathleen was such a sweet prof and really cares for her students. Her lectures can be a little heavy, but everything was comprehendible. Tests questions were almost exactly/the same as tutorial, practice exam and practice questions she provides. Kathleen also scaled our exams if she felt like it was needed, and was super fair with the content.
Why is that whenever you ask her a question, she answers in a condescending manner unless you are one of her favourites.

Kathleen is a gem. Had her for Summer 2021, she was SUPER CARING and understanding of the stress students face. Lots of free points on exams, adjustments to tough questions. However, to be clear, this course is NOT A CAKEWALK, you must STUDY HARD. Lectures are boring, but the material is interesting. Exams were difficult, make sure to study.

Her lectures are very clear and she also emphasizes what is and isn't important to know. She seems very passionate about the course material (and cats) and is very fair with her expectations and grading.

I would NOT recommend taking this course online. It covers lots of taught material that is incredibly hard to digest by yourself. Kathleen does not have office hours, so in order to see her get ready to write lots of emails. In general, course material is highly interesting if you are into the biology but think twice before doing it online.

Kathleen was fine. She didn't have any particularly bad traits as a prof, other than her sometimes snarky emails-- but really, she was very attentive to inquiries and was open to questions. Her lectures may be a little drawn out, but they mostly covered what was necessary. If you could sit through a 20-40 minute online lecture per week, you'd pass.

Kathleen is a great proof! If this course is taken online, the demonstration videos are really helpful and most of her test questions are focused on those topics. The final exam is supposedly cumulative but 95% of the questions came from the last three weeks especially from the chromosomal changes chapter.

Worst prof for this class. Everyone I know that has taken this class with her got a C or worse. She's condescending in her answers in email. She cannot explain material very clearly and her lecture slides are a mess. Take this class with literally anyone except for her.
Kathleen is an amazing prof!! Her class are great, she's very friendly and her lectures are interesting. Going to see her in her office hours really helps!!
She is pretty nice. The practice exam is helpful.

Kathleen was great. Most of her genetics problems revolve around fruit flies. The course was not too difficult if you did a bit of practice. The way she does exams is very good. First, you do the exam on your own, and then once finished, you do it again with a group. If you get a better grade in the group portion, then that's your grade.

Fitzpatrick's class was a blast this semester. She writes really thorough lecture slides so I never had to read the textbook. Easily got close to perfect on exams with minimal studying. I enjoyed a group portion of the exam for extra marks. Went easy on us, high averages, receptive to questions and generally laid back.

Decent teacher. Clickers were interactive. Tough marker. Wants word by word on exams and assignments.  Exams are too long for the time allotted. Sends rude and hostile emails to the class and has a poor attitude towards undergrad students. Does not like to be questioned or challenged when asked about curving midterms due to low class avg (D/C-).

Great professor! Does her best to explain to tough concepts in genetics. Her exams are fair. Undergrad students struggle because this is one of the first classes where you cannot just memorize material and expect to get an A. I recommend going to class. Put the effort in and you will succeed!
avoid.
Kathleen is an amazing lecturer, provided that you do your part and give in that extra time she will ensure you get a good grade. Super understanding and accessible!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER - EXTREMELY UNORGANIZED. I never missed a lecture, spent entire days working on her assignment because concepts were not gone through properly in class. Genetics is not an easy subject to grasp and she rushes through her material,  her exams which are 50 mins long whereas at least 2 hours to complete them is needed.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. Tests are extremely difficult. I studied the chapters in complete detail yet was lost during exams. she throws random questions that she hasnt ever introduced in the course. avoid avoid avoid. gpa destroyer
Online demonstrations were very useful and were good.
Not cool.

Midterms were short for the time allotted. 30 minutes for a 50 minute exam. Not enough time to check for answers. Not approachable for help or clarification and sends nasty, rude emails.  Class averages were low for the exams (D/C- range). I wouldn't take her again.

Extremely hard questions on genes, always follow her own idea throughout entire lecture by reading slides no matter you catch the idea or not... 30min only for each midterm, normally is 50min, there is no time left for you to check!!rest 20min goes for group discussion, discuss the exam u just completed!!what's the point????? GPA destroyer, avoid!!

Avoid her at all cost!! 1) Midterms became short, but EXTREMELY hard. Always give you what not taught in class 2) Horrible prof, there is no clear due date for online assignment. She keeps changing back and forth. 3) Useless teaching method, gone through power slide by speaking, but not much real content. Mostly unrelated stuff.

Horrible prof. She admits the first midterm is way too hard, and have not done anything with it. Extremely hard questions, always expect you to know everything. Don;t care whether u get the idea or not, Avoid her at all cost !!! Keep failing you

Great prof! Notes may not always match up to the posted power points but she gives you what you need to prepare for exams and do assignments. Tests are long, make sure to do lots of practice. If you listen carefully in class and watch the videos she posts showing you how to solve questions she tells you what to practice/know for the test.

Very interesting but challenging course, made more difficult by prof's explanations in the 2nd half. With that in mind, genetics is hard to explain in class. Its better to just actively learn via textbook questions and tutorial questions. Clicker questions are extremely helpful and prof encourages ppl to show up at office hours, which is nice.

For a student who excels in school I found this prof to be very disorganized which makes it hard to do well. The powerpoint slides did not match the ones in class. You are learning new material in tutorial apposed to reinforcing info. A lot of the class is applying your knowledge from basic concepts learned in class. Assignments were too difficult

Her midterms are definitely long so you should come very prepared during midterms because you will not have the time to pause and think. She gives extra marks. CLicker grades and tutorial marks are like bonus marks so always attend lectures and tutorials. Her exams are quite difficult, finals is not cumulative and she reply to emails quick.

Loved her and will take more courses with her if possible. midterms are long for the time given so you have to understand everything very well to finish in time. final was only worth 25% and not cumulative. Such a mvp. Do lots of practice and understand all the notes!

Kathleen is a natural educator. She really cares about her students' success and is always thinking of new ways to help you do better. This semester she was juggling 3 different courses, but still managed to make time to hold many office hours and do extra lecture recordings on difficult material. Great prof!

Took Bio102 Lab and bio202 with her. Lectures are interesting, but have a lot of information. For bio 202 assitsments are challanging, and midterms are too long for 50 min. Exam is not cumulative, tutorials are mandatory. Couldn't get her grading criterias, you can miss marks for something that is not asked, but she assumes you will right it.
Midterms are too long for the time given and rather difficult. She is scary when going to office hours and lectures are unorganized
seems approachable but is scary in her office hours, exams are way too long for time given and goes through difficult topics very fast
Really tough grader, tests were hard, and lectures were confusing. She was rude when asking for help.
Prof is just awesome

Lectures are boring, but filled with important information and clicker questions with marks for correct answers. Midterms are fair and if you practice you should be able to score high. Class isn't on the usual curve, so brace yourself. Exam marks are scaled based on the person who got the highest grade, not the average. Easy pass, hard A.

Sends overly emotional, rude, crass, nasty emails to the class. With the exception of the final, her exams were too long for the time. Exam avgs were a D/C- and not curved. She thinks of students as nuisances and is not at all approachable for questions. Try to pick a different professor if you can. One of the worst biology professors at SFU.

She was okay for this course. There are better professors for this class. She did teach the material well and Clickers were interactive. But the exams were too rushed for time limit, so you don't have time to check your answers. Also, she often wants more information than is needed on exams and is a picky marker.

I've taken alot of Biology courses, and Kathleen is actually a decent teacher. She goes out of her way in making the best lecture notes; textbook was hardly needed IMO. Her exams are very qualitative AND quantitative. Lots of writing, and preparation needed. If you dont have a passion for Biology, this course may not be the best.

The material and concepts of this class are not overly difficult, however she is an extremely difficult marker and exams are very, very rushed. Make sure you explain ALL your answers and be ready to take an 70 minute exam in 50 minutes.

She made it clear that she will not be raising grades to help people get into medical/dental schools. I tend to agree with her philosophy... so many underqualified students apply to such schools nowadays that there has to be someone to filter them out. All credit to her!

Deserves an emmy for best drama. Unapproachable to the extreme as evident from her rude emails to class: "This irritates me;you won't get a reference letter","I've never had so many complaining emails in a semester","My other class gave me tales of woe and reason of why I should count 1 exam less than the others","Please read before badgering me".
MIDTERMS WERE REALLY LONG AND HARD!!!

Not organized as she doesn't post stuff on time a lot. Rushes on some of the material. Made a mistake on last ? on the final.Sends rude emails which makes her come across as bitter. Midterms were ok though time-limited; picky marker. Try to take Donald Sinclair for 202. Unlike Kathleen, he is approachable, organized and welcoming to his students.

Did not enjoy this class one bit. Class average for all three exams were very low! D to C- range....doesn't scale, and will take off as many marks as possible on assignments and exams. I don't doubt her ability to teach, YES she can teach! but she is not approachable and seems to get angry when students challenge her, let alone ask her simple Qs

This is what she said in the end: (PAERT 1) "I won't be changing grades to help you get into med school or dentistry or grad school so please don't ask." ----this is the first part of what she said, coz of word limit check the next comment for the rest.

Ok let's keep this simple: This class is NOT scaled, a D is 50-55, so this class is really difficult. The Midterms and Final avg's was ~ a "D" ...so as much as I want to say this class is not hard..it is REALLY HARD...and having it not be scaled...is heart-breaking :(

exams are 70 mins long, and she expects you to finish it like a machine in 50 mins. a real exam is meant to be done way before the time limit, so that u can CHECK the answers u wrote. i remember in phys 101, midterms had 5 MC and 2 long questions. learn how to be a professor, kathleen.
She is an AWESOME bio prof who really knows her stuff.   Exams were completely fair and her notes are excellent and clear and prepare you well for her exams!  I totally recommend her!

Her final wasnt really cumulative, with only a couple questions from the prev. sections (that she will tell you) She puts funny exam covers (like no morse code or grunts to cheat?) However the exam(s) will take out almost everything out of you that you studied. Make sure to know the important stuff that she emphasizes on and go to tutorials.

A nice prof,very good notes such that the text was barely used, lectures werent boring maybe because of clicker Q's every class. Exams are sometimes fair, sometimes hard because this wasnt an easy course. Make sure you understand and not memorize. She tries to give out as many marks as possible and tries her best to help us understand the material.

She's a very helpful prof that really takes the time to help students understand each concept. Often she'll make quizzes (not worth marks) just so students can determine where they're having trouble. Her notes pretty much sum up everything, so the text isn't that necessary. Just make sure to do many of the practice problems for exams.

Great prof, explains concepts very well and spends time on making sure everyone understands. exams are fair and are similar to the assignments. her notes are well written so you don't need to use the textbook too much. she uses clickers every class so make sure you go. she also has a lot of enthusiasm in her voice so i didn't find many ppl sleeping
Very good professor, seems very friendly, takes class seriously, quite casual, you can relate to her, somewhat funny

exams were fair but u get marks taken off for things like spelling error.& theres no point in arguing for marks w/ him, he'll have an argument for everything even when its clearly unfair. when u ask him a question he'll spend 15 mins explaining it.its difficult to approach him bcuz he'll make u feel stupid with his face expression and tone of voice
Genetics was his life....so he took the class very seriously
Shes middle of the pack in terms of professors. I got a grade worser than what I wanted, so attend office hours with her more often and get 1 on 1 talks.

Ivona is a good lecturer, but is difficult because of how she grades things. Her exams have many short answer questions that are generally somewhat open ended, but the answers she wants are far more specific than the questions ask for. This makes it kind of feel like you are being graded by invisible, unknowable criteria. Grade scaling present.
watch out, too many lecture slides and goes by content too fast.

The class is challenging but manageable with dedication. While the professor's teaching style may not suit everyone, utilizing resources like the textbook and Unstuckstudy can help you succeed. Attend classes and stay on top of the material to earn a good grade.
Do not take an online class with her. She could not give 2 s***s about the 40 online students she had. Given audio recordings and basically sends you off to do whatever.
Avoid this prof at all cost.
Dr.M is a very nice person but her teaching style is okay. If you don't read the textbook or do the practice questions, doing well is difficult.

Ivona is a good lecturer. Her notes are what you'd expect from a bio class and encourages participation through iclickers. Her midterm was straightforward but studying is still required. Take advantage of the PEQs as it gives advice on how to solve each question. She rushed the content on the last day but should have just omitted those chapters. Gg

Ivona is very caring and values the success of her students. The content/ material of BISC 202 is heavy and gets progressively harder as the semester progresses, so don't fall behind - as the ideas build. Keep up with the PEQ's and make sure you understand every lecture, if you want to do well! Don't underestimate the rigour of this course.

really nice prof, genuinely cares about the students and pushed for involvement during lecture iclickers, especially following midterm results. midterm was about what you'd expect from a biology course and mixing lecture review and online sources helps to study concepts. definitely would recommend to understand genetics thoroughly.

Dr. M is teaching Genetics for the first time, and she has been adequate so far. The course is challenging, and is very content heavy. You have to put in a lot of work during the week to practice the material and grasp it fully. Exams are fair, and she is very accessible and understanding. Tutorials are mandatory and unfortunately a waste of time.

carol is a very good prof.  She is very available to students in her office hours( will stay for hours helping you).  To get an A in her class, read the lecture notes and UNDERSTAND the tutorials. Don't bother with text book at all.  If you have questions ask her for help.

Her lectures were extremely boring and dry, I skipped some lectures because the combination of her and the material was too much at times. She's not the best lecturer out there but she is definitely trying her best so the students can understand. She's always willing to help and shes a very nice prof. tests were very fair, but not that easy either.

TAs helps clarify materials than her, but that being said she's not a bad prof. Her midterms and "final" is pretty much like her tutorials, no memorization required, mostly just problem solving. Midterms are extremely easy if you do those practices.
Horrible instructor. She's so confusing and has trouble getting her point across.

I am an A+ student. I enjoy the challenge of tough hard-ball professors. Carol is not one of those professors. She's awful. Her exams are BS. I am thinking of retaking the class with someone else simply because I felt ripped off taking a subject I love so much with someone as awful as her.

It's really important to read the textbook since sometimes she has a hard time explain concepts. Otherwise make sure you understand the tutorials thoroughly  and try and do practice questions from the textbook since some of the exam questions were straight from the textbook questions.

Her teaching style doesn't require memorizing but more understand. I really enjoyed her teaching style and would definitely take another class with. If you do study the notes thoroughly and really understand the tutorials it should be easy getting a solid grade.

Carol is nice and tries to help, but she is unfit to teach the course since it is very scattered and the grading is extremely tough. Would absolutely not recommend unless you have to take this course right now and have to graduate, for example.
No point in going to lecture, stay at home and do the tutorial questions over and over again until you can dream about genetics and her types of questions at night.

Professor Lam is incredibly helpful and dedicated to student success. His lectures are well-structured, and the practice materials are invaluable. For exam prep, I found ChatGPT and unstuck study to be super useful alongside the provided resources.
Kevin is the Goat.

Dr. Lam is the best prof hands down. He explains concepts from the student's perspective, making them easy to grasp, from the pre-lecture videos to office hour notes, his effort in teaching is really amazing. It was surprising to see a professor that genuinely cares about their students and their success. I rlly recommend taking a course with him!

Great professor, super nice and attentive with all of his students. Highly recommend. Beware of his exams though! They're not that difficult if you study with all the exam mocks and exercises he provides, so use them all!

Professor Kevin Lam is an amazing prof and teaches very well and covers all of the lectures very nicely with a lot of practice questions and quizzes, however, the exams were horrible. His exams were very diffiicult and were much more broad than what the lectures covered. So make sure you do as much as practice possible to do great on the exam.
Highly recommend taking classes with Kevin. Always there to help!!
goat

Kevin was a great prof!! Super kind & easy to approach. Lectures were filled with text but overall he explained concepts well and prepared his students very well for tests. Midterm & final were very fair; if you study & do practice, you'll do well. He even gave us his personal phone number in case we ever needed him -- class or life related.

Kevin was clearly made for teaching. He genuinely cares and is there to help each and every one of his students. While it can be a challenging class, he tells you how to succeed & provides many resources to do so: each question comes with a very detailed explanation for solving it. Best prof at SFU (from my experience & what I've heard) def recomnd

One of the best prof's I have ever had at SFU!! I found the course content heavy but Kevin is very kind, caring and genuinely wants you to do your best. Make sure to do ALL the questions on the PEQs to help prepare for the midterm and exam :)

i cannot describe the respect i have for this prof. he is so kind and obviously cares about his students mental health and is still able to teach us what is needed. he's quite fair with marking and even if you're doing bad he will help out a lot, literally pages of advice on his sample exams! all profs should learn from him.

I LOVE KEVIN LAM. He gave such thorough and SO MUCH practice material I wouldn't be able to get through all of it even if I tried. I especially appreciated that he uploaded all his pre-lectures, lectures, and participation quizzes because I hate going to class (it was an 8:30) and I could just catch up on my own time. The midterms were fairly easy

He's a very nice and understanding prof. He puts a LOT of work into helping students actually understand the material, and if you study the way he tells you too the exams are not bad. Highly recommend doing his practice assignments. He's always available, and even gives his phone number. Probably the best prof I've had in uni so far.

Kevin is the most Amazing prof I have ever had! if u have a chance to take a class with  do it. The material it self is hard however he provides lots of help outside of the class including providing past exams and office hours from the past semesters. Try to understand everything fully by attending office hours

Dr. Lam was one of the best instructors I've ever had. He is truly passionate and caring and puts effort into helping you understand the concepts. His lectures are beneficial, as he goes through every topic step by step. If you attend his lectures and work on his practice questions, you will have nearly no problem with any course you take with him.
great prof

Kindest professor I have ever had. Very knowledgeable and incredible lecturer. His exams were somewhat difficult but he did an amazing job at explaining concepts and preparing you. Loads of practice available and very fair testing. I loved how he always had motivational speeches before class began. Highly, highly recommend.

Makes you think about HOW to actually solve problems step by step and applying it into the real world. Amazing amount of practice exams, make sure to always practice on your speed and accuracy. Write ALL you can answer as his exams are graded to the down 0.25 mark, which shows your skill level and how well you managed to capture the topics.
exams are hard if you don't do the practice questions. awesome prof

This guy is literally so amazing that he exceeded 5 point rating system, which should tell you enough about how amazing this guy is. Take his class, work hard, and he will give you the grade you deserve.

Dr. Lam is fantastic, he truly cares about all his students and does everything he can to allow students to improve their grades. He makes himself very available for questions during his office hours outside of class time and gives clear feedback that helps you improve your answers. The real difficulty is learning to write your answers clearly.

Kevin Lam is by far the most caring professor at SFU. He gives you all the tools needed in order to succeed in his course. Make sure to do the PEQs and all of the practice exams in order to prepare. His office hours make him very accessible for extra help in the course. Work hard and you'll be fine.

Kevin is the greatest of all time (g.o.a.t). In all my time at SFU, I have never had such a caring professor; nothing can and will compare. He is so clear with what he wants and expects; gives you all the necessary tools for success as well. The material and content is difficult for sure, but practice and attending office hours helps tremendously!

Very engaging and passionate about the content. He has recorded lectures and the option for in person lectures, as well as practice exams from years ago. Really willing to help students out and I wish he was the prof for every class. The course is still very challenging, but Kevin will go to great lengths so that you do well.

Kevin is one of the best instructors I have ever had. Very passionate about biology and puts in the effort to make sure his students understand the concepts. Tests can be difficult but as long as you pay attention in lecture, you should be fine.

After taking BISC 202 with Kevin I can definitely say he has been my favorite professor here at SFU. The class itself is by no means easy, but he makes it very engaging and enjoyable with his lecture participation questions. I would recommend anyone who is thinking of taking this class to try to and get it with Kevin as the professor

Kevin is by far my favourite prof at sfu so far!! He really cares about his students and sets you up for success. You do have to work hard in order to get a good grade but as long as you follow his advice and do the practice midterms/exams as he instructs, you will definitely get a good grade! Make sure to understand the main concepts and tools.

Prof Kevin is a real gem. He makes you work for your grade, but nevertheless everything you learn is relevant, interesting, and applicable. There are lots of lecture videos/prelecture videos, as well as post practice questions, but these will help you to better understand the concepts. Stay on track! If you fall behind, it'll show. Def worth it!

As the rating suggests, he is a "real gem". He is always there for his students and offers tons of bonus points for literally everything! This class is similar to math as there is much more application than memorization, so you have to practice regularly, however, he provides many resources and makes himself available even after his office hours!

Professor Lam genuinely wants his students to do well. Gives lots of exam practice (study the practice answer keys! you have to know how to phrase your answers correctly otherwise you will lose easy marks), has daily office hours leading up to tests. Don't fall behind, do practice qs, watch office hour recordings if you can. Take this class w/ him!

I've never met a prof like Kevin during my semesters at SFU. He really wants his students to succeed and provides them with many resources to do so. He will answer any questions you have and he's probably one of the nicest people I've met. The difficulty isn't anything crazy and his tests are very fair. You need to put in the work for a good grade.

The dude is the most goated prof at SFU. Gives a lot of advice, practices, and overall really good as a prof. If I didn't get a good grade, I gotta blame it on myself at the end cuz there were opportunities to get prepared. But you gotta learn from your mistakes instead of regretting them.

Professor Lam is the best prof I have had at SFU so far. He really cares about his students. He gives TONS of feedback with couching from his sample midterms and final exams. You have to work hard but if you follow his guidance you will do well

Kevin is a wonderful prof that truly cares about his students wellbeing and education! He was super helpful and very accommodating during the virtual session. Honestly attend the office hours because Kevin goes through strategies to help solve the questions and approaches the questions from a students perspective. Highly recommend!!!

Kevin is one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Super nice guy and you can tell he really cares about his students. He's super accommodating and easy to approach. Definitely a tough marker and he expects a lot. But if you follow his advice for how to approach the course (he gives lots of tips) and attend some office hours, it's not as painful.

Difficult tests but only because he tests your understanding, not how well you memorized things. Gives great advice at the beginning of each lecture. Gives out previous terms' midterms that have very detailed solutions with the grading criteria.

Probably my favorite professor here at SFU. He really cares about his students. Very enthusiastic and keeps lectures very interesting. He puts in a lot of work for his classes and expects a lot of work back from his students. Put in the work and you will do great.

Not an easy class at all, but he's very caring and nice. He really cares about his students and their wellbeing. Exam questions are new every semester so you cant memorize old exams. Lots of critical thinking involved.

Most valuable thing about is class was not the biology knowledge - but the fact that he taught us HOW to study. A skill I'll take with me way beyond Bisc 202. Not an easy class in any capacity, but is possible to do well with enough practise. Other SFU profs should take note - Kevin knows how its done, son.

A really great professor. You can tell he truly cares about his students and what he is teaching. Exams are difficult, but he provides lots of practise and feedback, so if you are willing to put in the time and effort it is not that hard to do well. Best professor I have had at SFU so far.

So accessible outside of class, cares a ton. Writes hard tests but adjust marks accordingly. people say he's too specific with what he wants you to write but this isn't true, you just need to thoroughly defend your answer and explain the logic behind why its fool proof. Has to be one of the best profs at SFU.

Kevin Lam is an amazing professor. He makes himself available to all students more than any other prof I've had, and makes a strong effort to ensure students know they can approach him with a problem. Incredibly organized with his lectures and schedule. Have never seen a prof put as much daily effort and care into their work as he does.

Kevin is a very kind person. He truly cares about his students and their success. His tests are tough, but completely doable. I'm an average student who's not insanely gifted. But as long as you keep up with practices and watch lectures you will do perfectly fine. It's a problem solving course not a memorization course.

Well it's true he's a very nice guy and in all fairness, he's probably better in person than online. He only cares about A+ students. His exams are way harder online than in person, he is obsessed about cheating and he's so specific with what he wants you to write. His lectures get monotonous, I got discouraged, never want to take genetics again

I joined this class with such high expectations based on what people rated. But to my surprise, his pure focus is to separate the utmost students between A+ and A, at the expense of failing EVERYONE ELSE in the class. His exams are nothing alike practice ones, and honestly his voice is extremely monotone. That being said he seems like a cool guy

Honestly, I wish nothing but the very best for this dude. Sure, kevins smart, competent, a great educator. But the biggest difference between him and other sfu staff? He cares. Can't tell you how much that means to students to know that some1 out there CARES. He made me love genetics ;def NOT an easy course. But if you grind ur butt off, you got it

I love Kevin. He is by far the best prof that I have ever taken a class with. He's caring and aware students take other classes (as most profs don't). He breaks down difficult concepts into small understandable steps, sometimes finishing lectures in videos, but it is worth it. Take the time to actually understand and not memorize and it's easy!

Truly the best prof in bio, if not the best prof at sfu. Really nice guy and a great explainer. Always willing to take time and go through material in office hours. This course requires a lot of work but if you work hard you'll get the grade you deserve. I highly highly recommend Kevin for 202 and for any other course he teaches.

Hands down one of the best profs ive had, had him fkr visxc 202 & 212. super caring and very good at conveying lecture material, he teaches in a way that gets u to think about the material and draw conclusions urself, which is really useful. He makes u work for the grade, but its worth it bc what u learn with him is super valuable

Was he nice? Yes. Was it difficult? Yes. Will I ever use it? No. Good prof + good explanations but very tough marker. You need very specific language and lots of detail in your answer. Good thing he gives you lots of time in exams. He also tends to end lectures late somewhat frequently through Youtube. Bonus marks for iclickers but only worth 5%.

Kevin is an amazing prof, he really cares about his students well being and success in their educational career. 202 is overall a harder course that you do need to spend a lot of time outside of class to receive top marks but Kevin's lectures are very detailed and he is always available for help. He is very welcoming to everyone! Highly recommend!

Kevin is the best BISC prof, hands down! LOVES his students and will go above and beyond to help you succeed! His lectures are straightforward and don't go overly detailed and he's always looking out for students, remembering names and offering tons of Office hours for as many people as he can help. Truly an incredible person.
Other Genetic Profs : I'm the best prof at SFU Kevin Lam : Hold my genes
Kevin is an A class human being. Such a wonderful person and a wonderful professor

Wonderful person and good lecturer. Exams are weird. Knowing the concepts is only half of it. His marking is based on whether you can phrase your answers the same as his answer key. I studied for both midterms and door poorly. I studied his style of wording answers and I got 92% on the final. Hes helpful in office hrs. I generally recommend him :)

You can really tell how much work he puts into the course and he really does care for his students. Gives VERY detailed answer keys to midterms so you know what to improve on, same with the practice midterms. You get a lot of freebie marks from clickers and online bonus quiz marks. You do have to do some prelec work but not too bad. Great prof!

Kevin is a personable guy but I will avoid his courses like the plague, as his expectations are comical: even serious keeners will find themselves struggling. Exams are crazy difficult with complex problems not covered in class or Mastering Genetics. He wants you to do practice exam qs each week but he doesnt provide answer keys, which is a joke.

Kevin is an overall great professor! We didnt have to pay for the textbook, which was GREAT and it is obvious that Kevin wants all students to succeed. I personally wasnt a huge fan of the flipped classroom teaching style or the extra videos we had to watch every week. This is a pretty hard class that requires dedication and a lot of review!
awful class

Its a hard course. Much harder than the first year biology courses. Kevin's exams and problem sets are hard and hes a very tough marker. Ive never worked so hard for a C in my life.. Also, hes probably the nicest guy Ive ever met.

I dont know what everyone's talking about. Amazing professor. The only proff at SFU that actually teach you something. Accessible outside class. If you solve the problems at the end of textbook, youll get a great mark cause he teaches you everything that you need. I absolutely recommend him.

Exams are ridiculously hard. If you aren't prepared to work, don't take his class. The amount of work required to normally get you a B would get you a C- or D in his class. Material on his exams are much more advanced than the ones shown in lectures,tutorials and homework. Kevin is the kindest prof I've ever had but he is also by far the toughest.

Many people saying that they weren't tested on the stuff in the lecture notes... That's because this course was a problem solving course, not a memorize fest like regular courses. You have to apply what you learned and think about each problem, and Kevin gave the tools necessary to do so. Great prof, would HIGHLY recommend this course and prof!

Kevin is the best prof ever! The midterms were clear, as well as the assignments. Just read his lecture slides and you're good to go! I didn't even touch the textbook.  I got a B and I didn't have to work that hard

Kevin is an awesome guy who really cares about his students. awesome lectures with a fun environment.  Not sure why everyone is giving him a poor rating, yes his tests are pretty hard but he teaches you all the tools you need, you just need to know how to apply them instead of doing the regular rehashed practice problems like other classes.
Tests are so hard! Not related to notes and practice questions

Taking this class for te second time... Im soo dissappointed.. so stressed out... I just want to pass to move on ..I dont know what to say.. just pretty shocked with his finals questions.. in overall he is an awesome teacher.. but exams are tough!!

Good at explaining what he is trying to explain but does NOT know how to test students.... Gives you exam questions that he hasn't even explained properly.  Regret taking this class with him. Take BIsC 202 with any other prof...
Kevin is amazing. Very clear lectures and very organized. Exams are super hard.

Dr. Lam was the toughest professor I  have taken in SFU. His lectures are really straight forward and understanding and his problem set and question are tough but if you spend some time on it, you should be able to solve. His exams are redicolously hard, don't expect any questions that you worked on to be in the exam, he makes up hard questions.

Dr. Lam is honestly one of the best profs: makes sure his students succeed, lots of office hours, extra problems, long thoughtful emails about course updates or questions and even makes pre lecture videos! responds to emails even if its day before exam. exams are not easy but he listens to your guys comments, make sure you take a class with him!

Dr. Christians is an awesome prof. He's kind, and he gives tons of practice questions on MasteringGenetics. The midterms have variations of the practice Qs so if you do as many as you can you'll be prepared for the time crunch.
Gives tests that are too long for the time allocated. Also not helpful for one on one visits

He explains the content really well. He makes the lectures interesting and I never got bored in his class. If you love biology then you will really love his style of teaching. Would definitely recommend this professor to anyone.

Julian was a great choice - friendly, patient. Did his best to answer questions in lecture, even when unsure of the answer. He listened to feedback that MT1 was too long and made MT2 shorter. Written Qs in the exams were similar to weekly quiz questions. The final was very similar to the sample. Not your average bio class. Practice the material.

He is an okay prof who knows his material well. Clickers are a good way to study for exams as well as his tutorial slides. Exams are long but they are fair. Went to his office hours to get help for the practice final but he told me to go look at the slides & didn't provide much help. He was much more helpful after lecture tho on the same day^
This guy is the guy you want to take a class with. He really understands his subjects.

This class is going to be my first fail. I failed the first 2 midterms. The midterms are brutal, as they are too long to finish in 50 mins. None of the questions he used in the practice midterm are on the midterms :/ He's too hard, avoid him.

He gave us practice midterms and did not provide an answer key and told us to compare answers with other students. He said the problem was that students will memorize answers or post the practice exams online. While that is understandable, we had no idea if we were doing anything right or not. His lecture notes are hectic and confusing as well.

Incredibly well organized class. Gives you everything you need to do well. Lectures were interesting and well coordinated and the Clicker question not only tested your understanding, but drew attention to common exam errors. Exams were quick but more than fair. Favourite class and prof so far.

He's changed up his genetics course from now on. Tests are fair, midterms have balance of hard and easy questions. Final was the most standard final I've ever written, very fair with no surprises. Lecture notes leave some things out so listen to recordings when it seems like something isn't explained fully on slides.

Condescending and arrogant, he used copy and pasted lecture notes and MasteringGenetics problem sets so he's clearly in the pocket of textbook companies and not willing to put any effort whatsoever into actually teaching the course. Bad attitude towards students and very difficult exams.

I am usually very good at biology courses, however, genetics with this professor really shot down my confidence. His exams were very hard, nothing like mastering genetics and also he was quite rude whenever I would come for help. I studied off of his notes mostly but that was no help so if you take it with him learn everything on your own.
I don't know about his other classes, he might be good at them. However, his genetics class was a surprise, especially his final exam. He loves problem sets, but rarely explains them.
He barely goes over problem sets, but he expects you to know everything. his notes are all textbook copy paste.

If you are taking genetics do not sign up for it w him!!! His lectures are bad enough and he does not test u in theory at all... He never goes over problems and he expects u to know everything he is only there re-reading the book!!! This course with him is a self(book)teaching and expect to be surprise

His midterm was fair, but his final was tough! There were some questions which were abstract and required a lot of thinking. Still fair though even though it was worth 60%. I would recommend him to anyone! I find him funny, nice, and love how he is always open to suggestions on improving the course. Great guy, great TA's! Thanks Dr. Hutter!

I like this guy! He's very funny and friendly. One thing that I really liked was how he always told us interesting articles and facts to connect to the course content. He's a bit monotone, but if you actually listen to him the things he says are really interesting and funny. His lecture slides needs a bit more detail, but his midterm is very fair.
Great TA and very nice guy. Very helpful
best TA out there for genetics! Other TAs literally dont do anything for their students and this guy holds his own review sessons
Awesome TA and cares about his students

He just reads off the slides and when someone asks a question, he gives a really vague answer. His slides and pre-lecture videos aren't even made by him, tons of iClickers. His exam is so-so, a lot of stuff not even covered during lec. I have to basically self teach myself. TAs seem much more knowledgeable. Aside, he's friendly.
the exams and the homework/lecture slides dont correlate at all
standard read off the slide prof, except the slide dont even have any info theyre just all iclicker
the lectures and mastering gentics are a level 1 and the exams are a level 10, wish he actually taught in lecture rather than doing iclicker

he doesnt really seem to know anything about the course, he makes us watch pre lecture videos which are essentially the lecture, and then during lecture time all he does is iclicker questions. the answer for the question is never explained by him, he asks a student to explain the solution, and the rest of the class can never hear or understand

Good prof, had a good experience with him in bisc 202 , explains lectures well and uploads pre-lecture videos for extra help. Does in class i clicker questions, midterms are frequent but fair. Overall a good class and a good prof. You just need to put in the time to look over all lecture slides.

Mike is a really nice guy but not very good at teaching. This is a difficult course and he doesn't explain the concepts well enough. He gives 4 short midterms (usually out of 20) and a final exam which was out of 52, so if you want to get a high grade you can't lose many marks on the exams. The textbook was not helpful, just buy the access code.

Mike is an OK prof, super nice, tutorials were not helpful. Read textbook ahead and make sure you understand all concepts before class. Tests were short, so its somewhat hard to demonstrate understanding in all concepts. Not sure if Id recommend him but also not sure if I wouldn't. Some memorization, mostly practice, weekly quizzes and assignments.

Mike is a nice guy in general but he shouldnt be a lecturer. Not for this class at least. Went to class to get iClicker participation marks, not to learn. YouTube taught me 90% of the course material. I also had to buy a $120 textbook that was not useful as it was way too detailed for the course, but you NEED the access code that comes with itï¿½ï¿½

Hart is a sweet human being, but his notes and lectures are so vague while his exams are incredibly precise. They're also only out of 20, so if you mess up even one question you lose a whole letter grade. There's no clear distinction of what you should really know for exams but they still have high expectations.

Tutorials sucked, my TA was mean even though I participated regularly, never skipped, and knew most of the material. The T/F questions are worth 4/20 on the exam and theres only 2 so be careful! Dont take this class with him or Kevin, they teach the course the same way. Very picky marker, gave me 0 on a question out of 2 bc I forgot to add 1 word

Mike is good at explaining concepts. In order to do well, it's important to come to class prepared and understand concepts. Exams are a bit low on points, so if you miss one question your grade goes down by a bit. Always accessible for extra help.

Michael Hart isn't a good prof at all. His lectures aren't his own, and he doesn't put in any effort to make himself a good teacher. His exams are hard and he's very picky about his answers. The level of difficulty on exams also don't match up with the level of difficulty in the lecture/tutorial/online questions.

I typically perform above average in biology but he rushes too much in class and exams are too short, hes a very picky marker, does not even give out half marks. Exams are usually out of 20 and most questions are worth at least 5 marks. I think I might have to redo this class :(. Please avoid him. Hes super nice but not worth lowering your gpa.
Tough tests, good lectures.

Clicker questions in class, textbook readings are not tested on, no answers posted for practice questions, only had one job - to read the lecture slides, didn't even finish that 90% of the time, you have to finish it on your own or he posts post lecture videos where he finishes his reading, tutorial quizzes were super tough

Mike is a nice guy but his teaching is awful. When you ask him a question to clarify something, he doesn't give you a direct answer. He just talks about the theory behind the answer which could cause more confusion. Also, how exam questions are worth so little 1-3 point per question even if it's a long calculation question that could've worth more

BISC202 is a tough course. MUCH harder than the regular biology class because there is zero memorization and lots of problem solving. Mike doesn't make this course any easier. His midterms start late and end early. We had only 35 minutes to write. Problem sets are also much harder that concepts taught in class. Very nice guy though.
if you did the practice questions and went through the lecture slide iclickers, the final was probably very easy for you. absolute legend of a prof

Nice guy, but not a good teacher. Didn't even write his own lecture notes. Has a tendency to ramble on about insignificant details, but misses big ideas in his overly-busy lecture slides. Kind of assumes that you learn this stuff through osmosis. AVOID, especially if not a BISC major. Hard course in general, but could be taught better.

Mike seems like a cool guy but BISC 202 was terrible with him. I was pretty excited to learn about genetics and was willing to put the work in but I was left clueless after every lecture. The problem sets do not resemble what he teaches in class. No answers available for practice questions.. some quizzes were decent while others were HARD(low avg)

Uses clickers. Pre-Lecture videos help to understand concepts. Textbook readings definitely not mandatory for exams. Be prepared for quizzes in tutorials and weekly questions. Clickers and questions are for participation only. Midterms are extremely time constrained. Otherwise, the material isn't super difficult to pick up. Interesting lectures.
If you have half a brain you'll be able to navigate your way through his class and even manage to do well. He tells you exactly what he's going to test you on. Sometimes it pays to go to class.
pretty easy class...dont skip too amny lectures...read the text...problems are alot harder than his midterm or final questions
No Comments

Oh god... why is he teaching? Felix will stand up at the front of the class and drone on for 50 minutes about stuff that he doesn't even understand. He makes even the simplest concepts confusing. Take this class ony if you want mind numbingly boring and repetitive nonsense. "Purple and purple makes purple... and purple and purple makes purple..."

He was great but I also had the best TA you could ask for. He never asked anything that wasn't covered.  He's kinda ****y but it's funny if you're not the one pissing him off becuase usually the person deserves it.
I thought he was really good!  He never tested us on anything he didn't say in lecture, if you think he's so bad maybe you guys should just listen to him!
No Comments
he doesn't know what he's saying
tells you what to expect, good notes
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
always wants to take off POINTS from students
No Comments
No Comments
Should stick to research and forget about teaching!

Makes everything very clear. Tells you exactly what will be on her midterms. Anything she does not go over in class, she won't expect you to know. Is extremely considerate and really cares for her students. Would consider taking upper level courses with her in the future.

SHE IS AMAZING. she takes time to make sure everyone understands the content. She really enjoys feedback. She was behind in her lecture slides the whole semester and didn't care because she just wanted us to understand the course. She really is amazing. Midterms are easy if you review and study!

Esther is better than i could have ever hoped! Her exams are fair, The midterm had averages in the low 80's to high 70's. We had a prof come and teach while she was away and both of his lectures did not make any sense at all, when she came back she re did both in 30 mins and they were perfectly clear! Take Bisc 202 with her if you have the option!

Very fair prof. She explains concepts clearly and her exams are easy to do well in if you show up to class and pay attention. She encourages questions and is happy to clarify but it is genetics so stay on top of it the material because it does get harder.

Amazing prof. Pay attention to her notes and youll be fine. Shes caring and listens to what students have to say. Midterms werent that hard if you tried to study and do well (mc, matching, and some short/long answer Q's). Pay attention to the wording on her midterms, they can be vague so ask questions EVEN during the midterm. She encourages Qs.

She explains material clearly in lectures. Reasonably accessible in office hours. Make sure to keep up with the lectures and notes. Do not fall back, otherwise you will not do well. Draw out the concepts to help you understand.

One of the best prof I had ever had in my university years. She speaks very clearly which allows people to focus well, and is a very fair marker. She is very nice, and wants all the students to do well on exams. I recommend taking BISC 202 with her. Awesome prof.

Prof is alright. she seems to have some sort of attitude when people ask her questions in class. Read the textbook if her notes don't make sense, and remember to keep up with the material. Midterm 1 wasn't that hard if you tried to study and do well (mc, matching, and some short/long answer Q's).
